glsa.title: Apache 1.3: Buffer overflow in mod_proxy
glsa.synopsis: A bug in mod_proxy may allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code when Apache is configured a certain way.

background.p: The Apache HTTP Server Project is an effort to develop and maintain an open-source HTTP server for modern operating systems. The goal of this project is to provide a secure, efficient and extensible server that provides services in tune with the current HTTP standards.

description.p: A bug in the proxy_util.c file may lead to a remote buffer overflow. To trigger the vulnerability an attacker would have to get mod_proxy to connect to a malicous server which returns an invalid (negative) Content-Length.

impact.p: An attacker could cause a Denial of Service as the Apache child handling the request, which will die and under some circumstances execute arbitrary code as the user running Apache, usually "apache".
